WRITING.TEXT:
My uncle who has been living in the middle east for a while came to visit us (in the U.S.) and is staying for about a month. I really dislike generalizing about a specific culture or society, but during his entire visit he's done nothing but bully and poke fun at me. He makes me feel insignificant in everything I do. He has his physics PhD and doesn't take what I'm studying (psychology and biology major) seriously. The other day, he asked me about what I even do as a psych tutor and when I started explaining some psychological theories he laughed ironically and said "HA HA HA. PSYCHOLOGY DOESN'T HAVE THEORIES." _
I would blame it on ignorance (a lot of people don't believe psychology is a science) but he said it in a way to make what I'm doing seem inconsequential or for simple minded people.
He's constantly berating me about everything I'm doing. It's gotten to the point that every morning, I get panicky when I have to go downstairs to eat something, because he always asks me what I'm doing today and honestly, I'm not doing much these days because it's my summer break and I like to relax after a long semester, and he'll just make me feel terrible when I tell him I'm just going to try to read and clean and do laundry and stuff.
I don't know what his problem is, but he seems to get a kick out of making feel bad about myself. Even about small stuff. He called me lazy and messy because the other day I was wearing mismatched socks even though I was inside my room the whole day, it wasn't like I was going anywhere fancy and wearing mismatched socks :(
Even about the serious stuff. Today he was making fun of me because things with my parents are getting bad and they might get a divorce, and we're in a big financial mess and we might lose our home so he made fun of me about that by laughing and saying "HA HA HA! SOON YOU WON'T HAVE A HOME! YOU'LL BE HOMELESS!!" after I remarked that the U.S. is my home and I wouldn't wanna live anywhere else.
The other day I even overheard him tell my father that he believes women generally have smaller brains so you have to dumb yourself down treat them like children sometimes.
Honestly, my patience is wearing thin with this man. I'm at my wits end and don't know how to deal with him. I would say that it is just an attitude that was indoctrinated into him because of the culture he was raised in, but he is actually pretty decent with my older sister and doesn't make half of the bitter or hurtful "jokes" with her.
I try to think of it as him just trying to "joke" around with me, but most of the things he says are very hurtful and not very appropriate to joke about. I guess he doesn't realize it? How do I combat his rude remarks and cruel jokes or should I just keep ignoring it until he has to leave? Is this even worth confronting him about? If anyone has gone through something similar, any advice would be appreciated! I'm a 21 year old female just fyi.

I totally understand how you feel because something very similar is happening to me. It really sucks!! Especially the whole ignoring your existence on Facebook part.
Some people might think, well it's just Facebook and it doesn't really matter because it's just some social media website, but like you said, it's a public forum where all or most of his friends and family are congregated and him not adding you on it, coupled with the fact this is a long distance relationship and you will hardly ever interact with those people will definitely make you feel like he's hiding you from that part of his world. It's not far fetched to feel like he's doing that because he's embarrassed or ashamed, even though that might not be his intention. Something very similar is happening to me, so I know *exactly* how you feel about feeling hurt even though your rational side is telling you not to be.
It might not seem extremely logical to people why someone would get hurt over facebook but the implications of his behavior or the assumptions that you can draw from them (i.e. he hasn't added you because he's hiding your relationship or feels embarrassed) can be extremely hurtful. I don't really have any advice on how to deal with that feeling, as I'm trying to figure out how to deal with it myself :( , but I think a long talk where you really discuss how the whole situation is paining you and asking him directly why he has her added but not you and discussing why he still hasn't told his parents (IT'S BEEN 2 YEARS!!) would make you feel a little better. Definitely communicate with him everything that you've been feeling! Even if you already talked about it, letting him know how it's making you feel still can help him realize how this is affecting you, because who knows, maybe he's just ignorant to how the whole situation is really making you feel. The worst thing you can do is keep it in and let it boil inside of you until you just lose it one day (take it from me!!).
If you need someone to talk to I'm here. Good luck!

On the one hand, they might just be friends and there is no romantic interest between them, but on the other hand he *did* lie to you about talking to her only on Skype. To me, that's what would set off a red flag. Not the fact that he has her added as a friend or anything (because most people have friends of the opposite sex who are just friends), but the fact that he went to the lengths of lying to you about it. It might mean there's something else going on. In my experience, when someone lies, there's always a reason behind it. Maybe he just didn't want to upset you or wanted to make you feel special by telling you that he was only friends with you from chat roulette. Or maybe there's something more going on. I can't answer that, but my best advice is to you is to be careful, because once someone is willing to lie to you about something or someone, then there is usually an ulterior motive and intentions aren't very pure.
In a long distance relationship, what do you really have but each others' trust and loyalty (since you can't physically be there with each other), so sneakiness can undermine the whole thing. I understand how you feel like you want to read through his messages, just so you can know what's really going on, but that would be an invasion of his privacy and might jeopardize your entire relationship. You definitely should try talking to him and making sure he knows how you feel about the whole situation (especially about him lying about it), because if you keep it in you might end up resenting him and things will fall apart quickly.
TL;DR Talk to him about it. Be careful. Try not to go through his stuff.
